metadata.title: CVE-2018-20184 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.4 snapshot-20181209 Q8, there is a heap-based bufferoverflow in the WriteTGAImage function of tga.c, which allows attackers tocause a denial of service via a crafted image file, because the number ofrows or columns can exceed the pixel-dimension restrictions of the TGAspecification.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.4~hg15873-1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.4~hg15873-1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.4~hg15873-1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.4~hg15873-1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.4~hg15873-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4~hg15873-1').
